Reviews.Title: “fine place in an intriguing neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: apkt
Reviews.Content: our stay at antiqua roma was very satisfactory--the place actually exceeded our expectation of a b&b, with basic amenity readily available. although we were not sure about the detached bathroom, it turned out not at all a problem (unless you run into someone in the hallway, which happened only once during the three-night stay). the manager was efficient and kind to give us directions etc. what was most interesting about this place is its location. it is a little off the center in terms of sightseeing; however, a short walk around the block gives you an idea of what the real life in rome is like. for breakfast, as there was none provided in this b&b, we enjoyed sitting in a cafe nearby, watching locals getting ready for work. for this reason only, we would go back to antiqua roma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great surroundings, nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rob0208
Reviews.Content: We booked Antiqua Roma basically because of its location and the great reviews we had seen on tripadvisor. We paid roughly €100 per night (which appears to be cheap in Rome) and stayed for 3 nights around mid-September. The hotel was perfect, the room we stayed in was big, had its own bathroom and had an amazing balcony overlooking the street, from which you could see the river. Upon arrival we were greeted with a bottle of local red wine and given a rough guide to where everything is (including a map to help out). Everything me and my girlfriend went to see was within walking distance, we literally didn't get one cab or bus for the whole stay. The colosseum is a good walk (maybe 25 minutes) but Rome is so beautiful that it is absolutely no chore. Most corners you turn contain something beautiful or ancient. The squares there are great for the early evening, and in September the weather was amazing. My only very slight criticism is that the hotel appears to be in a business district in Rome, so not many eateries and restaurants in the immediate vicinity will stay open late. But to cross the river to the 'tourist' side of Rome only takes 5 minutes, and over there everything is open until late. Due to it being in a more quiet part of the city, everything is much quieter at night - so a good nights sleep is easy to come by! I would definitely recommend Antiqua Roma, me and my girlfriend had a fantastic time and recommended it to a number of people once we were home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice older hotel, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelfamily4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed it and would stay again. The rooms aren't great, however I think that is the trade off in Rome. The best locations are older buildings. The newer hotels are a little farther out. The hotel is well kept and clean and the staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “tremendous stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: john e
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for four nights in February and had a marvellous stay. Enrico was a charming host. The location is great, very central with all the important sights within walking distance. Shuttle bus from airport stops 2 minutes away and runs every 30 minutes. Rooms very spacious and clean. Free internet access and there is a coffee shop next door ideal for breakfast and very reasonably priced. Will be visiting again for sure as this is the ideal base for visiting the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Researched many places and are so glad we chose Antigua Roma for affordability, comfort, beauty, and service.”
Reviews.Author: Mare123Portland
Reviews.Content: We were only in Rome 3 days/2nights and were really glad to have called this our little home. Would love to return. The host was so helpful and friendly. You'll be well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Vero123_12
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time in Antiqua Roma and Enrico was a wonderful host. It is very well situated, as you are close to all of the important sights. The rooms were spatious and clean, we will definitely recommend it to all our friends and family and we will definitely stay there again next time we are in Rome. Highly recommended to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: laaldeana
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Antiqua Roma was amazing! Not only Enrico was extremely helpful and kind but the B&B is centrally located close to Piazza Cavour. There is an airport shuttle that leaves you two blocks away for 6 euros. Also public transportation and major sites are close by. The experience was incredible, the rooms are super clean and there is nothing to complain. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated cozy place run by a perfect host Enrico”
Reviews.Author: Ra-alimann
Reviews.Content: The best place at all you can be when visiting Rome. Close to the Castle of St. Angelo it is perfectly situated in order to see all the main spots literately within minutes by foot. Enrico is an amazing host, very cheerful, very attentive and very supportive. The room we had right next to the front door left-hand side was roomy, nicely decorated, bright and most of all clean and the same goes for the bath facilities. Calm and safe neighborhood. super bargain. Easily approachable from the airport as the shuttle coach just stops around the corner at Piazza Cavour. Again at any time! Alfred from Germany

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and spacious”
Reviews.Author: mauinoel
Reviews.Content: Enrico was very helpful in providing bus directions to the hotel for my boyfriend who was coming from southern Italy by train. Although it required a little rescheduling for him to make it there by the 9pm check-in time, he was happy to make it in time to do some exploring before I arrived the next morning. It was also really nice to have free internet access during our few nights there although we had to go into the hallway to get a signal. Having the bus so close made it easy to get around although we wound up walking most of the time (bring comfy shoes and be careful on the stairs down as they can be a bit slippery). It was nice not to have to stay by the train station, but to know that it was easy enough to get to when it was time for us to leave for Florence. In the evening, that area seemed to quiet down considerably, so on the way back, you may want to grab water or whatever you'll need before crossing the Ponte Cavour. One thing that there's no shortage of in Rome is places to eat though; my boyfriend went out and found some of the best pizza I had on our whole trip on my first night there when I was too tired to go out. I only truly came to appreciate the neighborhood that we were in on our last night in Rome, when there was no availability at Antiqua Roma and we had to stay near the train station where the streets are much more hectic and filled with tourists (although you can never truly escape us). We had a nice double room with a balcony and an en suite bathroom, which was great. Enrico let us leave our bags in the hallway for a few hours after checking out (the check out is a little early at 10am), which was helpful although then we did not have access to a bathroom. Even though there are bathrooms in the hallway, they are for the rooms, so there's no communal restroom to use, FYI. Others have mentioned the street noise, which was there, but not much of a problem for us. Waking up to the sounds of an Italian argument and some horn honking was oddly entertaining and just a good reminder to get out there and start exploring. The shutters completely darkened the room so if not for the noise, I may have slept through the whole beautiful morning. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful rooms, great host, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ozmoz1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at a spacious double room with bathroom for a weekend in September. The B&B is on a single floor of a large stone-walled building built in early 20th century. The building is typically Roman, and street it is on is nice with small shops and a few cafes. Reaching the hotel is extremely easy with SIT bus that has a stop on Piazza Cavour located about 50 meters away. The room is very nicely decorated with many amenities you can find in a regular hotel but with an added personal touch in decoration. Our host Enrico is one of the nicest persons we met during our travels who goes out of his way to help us for everything we may need. The location is perfect. It is located just across the river next to Palace of Justice. Every place you want to visit in Rome is within walking distance. For example one of the furthest touristic place colosseum is 30 minutes away by walking. Of course, on your way you see lots of wonderful distractions, this duration may increase considerably. From what we have heard from past visitors to Rome, finding a good place within a reasonable budget at the historic center is almost impossible. This makes Antiqua Roma extremely unique and we strongly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_travels
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a short stay at the Antiqua Roma and it met all of our expectations. We could easily walk to all of the city's main attractions in under half an hour (some much nearer), but the building was situated far away enough to escape the crowds and provide a little peace and quiet. Our room was spacious and comfy - complete with four poster bed and free mini bottle of wine on arrival. Bathroom, although outside the room, was nice and clean, and having a sink in the room was really handy. Enrico was also extremely helpful in providing us with travel info and maps. All in all, really good value for money - would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “nice base to tour rome”
Reviews.Author: vcvcvc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night at the end of may. Enrico was super nice and friendly, provided us with free map and let us borrow several guidebooks. the room and bathroom were clean. the hotel location is good, as its really close to taxi, bus stops and Vatican. the neighborhood was good as well with several food places right next to it. One gotcha though is that it was loud. it is not very sound proof at all and you get a lot of street noise inside the room. We woke up several times a night by different noises, including the noise of the garbage pick up truck which made its round to this neighbor hood at 2AM. Its relatively cheap for being so close to everything and being in the nice part of town however if you are a light sleeper beware.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulas, friendly, homely, authentic italian atmosphere, which went the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: HannahandBex
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Rome for her 30th birthday. We were a little concerned being a same sex couple staying in a double room within the vatican area, but we were made very welcome. It felt like we were staying in someone's home, with lots of italian artefacts, paintings, books (which you could borrow). It was beautifully simple, yet authentic. The landlord, Enrico, was incredibly friendly, lending us a plug socket which allowed us to use our british gadgets and went out of his way to ensure we had all that we needed. He made my partner's day when we returned to the B&B on the eve of her birthday to discover a little card and small birthday present along with a bottle of wine and cork screw. We were both really touched by his kindness. He made our stay in rome very special. We shall certainly return again. Although there was no breakfast at the B&B literally the next building along was a cafe which served international breakfast for 8 euros which included coissant, scrambled eggs/ omlette and two coffees. We felt well set to go after that!! The location is great..... to the right you make your way to the vatican and to the left to the bridge which takes you to the centre. It felt very safe at night walking home and everywhere you look (up) you see the most beautiful buildings and where ever you are heading to you often accidentally stumble across a beautiful fountain, statue or building. My partner's birthday was brilliant in rome and was made extra special by Antiqua Roma..... so thank you very much... and we shall see you again Hannah and Bex xxx

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean & Safe”
Reviews.Author: koo_clan
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at AntiquaRoma for 2 nights. Our room comes with a private bathroom that is outside of our room along the corridor. I am actually not very comfortable with this setup but I choose this B&B anyway, due to its location since we will only be in Rome for such a short duration. Room size is decent, with a miniscule TV, wifi & a sink. The location is excellent, within walking distance to all major spots. The only hassle we had was when we first arrived in Rome from termini station but it might be due to me who choosed took Bus # 492 instead of bus #70 as advised by Enrico. Other than the 1 Euro per pax spent on this bus trip to the B&B, my husband & I walked to all spots since we do not want to spend time waiting for buses / metro. There is a bus shuttle that goes directly to Fumicino Airport (about 5 mins walks from B&B, 8 Euros per pax). Took about 1 hour to reach from B&B to airport, since traffic was pretty jam at 8:30am.. Enrico has a vast collection of rome guides books at the hall & the maps provided were helpful. My husband is a avid MU football fans, so we went to a underground Irish pub, near theater Adriano (10 mins walk) to watch the quarter finals for Champions League. All in all, I can find no fault with this B&B. Enrico was curteous and helpful with all our questions. He even waived the newly implemented room tax & gave us a farewell gift. Oh there is a quaint lift so if you have large luggages such as ours, it will be no problem..except for th 4-5 steps to the B&B's ground apartment "lobby".

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: traveljen7
Reviews.Content: This really is a great spot that is within walking distance of just about everything you'd want to see. It was very warm and comfortable to come back to after a long day. The people were nice, although not overly helpful when we had questions. One of the days was pouring down rain and we were soaked. We asked if there was a dryer in the building we could use or one nearby but we didn't get any help. The location is great and overall the pictures on the website don't show how cozy it is. We would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay near Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: tweenfounders
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the place to stay in if you are planning for a trip to Rome. Reasons? 1) Safe Neighbourhood - it's near to Vatican City. If you are paranoid about safety and a lazy traveller like us who love checking out St Pietro at night but too darn lazy to take a bus/metro to get back to the hotel, this is a good place for you. You can snap pictures all you want at St Pietro, feel the precious-breezy-holy moment, enjoy the atmosphere, buy some hot dogs along the way and get home safe and happy. We are girls by the way. 2) Good rate - The double room is at a reasonable rate, spacious, uniquely Rome nice and most importantly, it's neat and CLEAN!! and I love the toilet. :) I am very particular about toilets. Sucky toilet is a definite no-no for me. And and... :) they make up your room everyday. Yay! :) 3) Great host - Enrique is friendly, very efficient and one English speaking dude. He showed us the map on where to go ,how to go and how long it takes to get to a place. And oh, he's very generous as well. If your stay falls on your birthday you will get a complimentary champagne bottle by surprise. :) :) Nice naw? And he gives us free map! Double Yay! 4) Internet - It's nice to feel connected to the cyber world for FREE! :) In our other stays in Paris, Florence, etc, we have to pay to get connected. :( So it feels like home when you can check your Facebook every now and then. In fact, that's what we do every night at Antiqua Roma -- yes we are paranoids and have no life. :P We are missing Antiqua Roma already... cheesy it may sound but it's the truth. We love coming back to our room early every night because it gives us this sense of cosiness and chillaxness. Would definitely recommend this to anyone and come back for sure. God bless.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AnuP2D
Reviews.Content: Great location with a very nice and friendly owner. The service lady was also very helpful through our visit. Bathroom was separate from the room. We did not opt for the breakfast since there was a nice little cafe right next door that served fresh breakfast. The room was large and well decorated. Had a shared computer for internet access. Reasonably priced for Rome

Reviews.Title: “Nice find in Rome. Good location to walking to all locations. Very close to Vatican.”
Reviews.Author: FoolishBurrito
Reviews.Content: I found Antiqua Roma to be the best value for a good quality B&B at a good location. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews talk about the noise on the street at night, but I found it to be extremely quiet, except for the recycling trucks that come by early in the morning, we didn’t hear anything. The location is ideal if you don’t mind walking. If not, there is a couple of bus stops very close and the nearest subway stop is at the Spanish Steps, about 15-20 minutes away by foot. When you walk out of the B&B, you have your choice of 3 directions depending on where you want to go. There are two bridges close, both less than 5 minutes walk, that take you to the most popular destinations. To get to the Vatican is very easy, it’s about 10 minutes away. The Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, and the Spanish Steps are about a 20 minute walk, with the Colosseum and Trastevere area about 30 minutes walk. I bought the Roma Pass at the airport and didn’t use it to it’s full potential. I took the subway to the train station to pick up a car once and took the subway to the Colosseum once, and walked back. I took a taxi from the train station upon arrival and it cost me Euro 35,00 and it took about 15 minutes in traffic. The Building has an elevator and we had no problem getting our large suitcases and duffels up to the room. Enrico met us at the top of the elevator and showed us to our room. We arrived early in the morning and our room was ready for us already which was nice. We got the room without the insuite bath. The room was large, plenty of places to put suitcases and duffels with plenty of room to walk around, and has a sink, which is nice to be able to get ready without leaving the room. The bathroom is down the hall and private. There really isn’t a common area and we only saw one other couple in the hallway the entire time we where there. The room had a large double bed with a canopy and there was a small bottle of wine waiting for us. The fixtures were modern and there were plenty of places to plug in cellphones, laptops, etc. We stayed 3 nights in late June and it was very hot in Rome. There is no A/C in the room, but there is a fan and we were comfortable. I get hot easily and don’t sleep well when it’s hot and I was fine. There is free Wi-Fi but it was a very weak signal in the room. We were down the hall however, other rooms are probably a bit better, and there is a small desk in the hallway in an area with good reception. Tip: book your Vatican tour with www.angeltours.com We loved them. Small groups, no headset. I would highly recommend this place for travelers who like the freedom of walking to their destinations and are looking for a good value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We certainly know where to stay next time in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: OBbk
Reviews.Content: We want to thank Antiquaroma very much for our stay in Rome in April and in particular for the extra free night because of cancelled flights back home for volcano erupted. When we picked a place to stay in Rome during our first visit there, we searched for location and price, after having searched the net a for long time for adequate B&B, we took a chance on AntiquaRoma and the place met - by far - all our expectations for a good, nice, convenient and safe place to stay!!!! We have spoken highly about AntiquaRoma to friends after our return home and we certainly know where to stay next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, practical and charming.”
Reviews.Author: stalbotDublin
Reviews.Content: The apartment was well maintained, with a live in house keeper. This was useful when picking up the keys, as there is usually someone in. The hotel is tasteful and well presented, with unique pieces of art and antiques. The surrounding area was quiet, very central and felt safe at night. On google maps ‘street view’ the road and surrounding buildings look like they are undergoing repair works. However, I was glad to see, this is not the case anymore. I had picked this hotel as people on trip andvior had raved about how helpful Enrico was. They weren't exaggerating. We visited during the week that the Icelandic volcano erupted and Enrico was very helpful and supported us finding new travel arrangements and printing new tickets, without charge. We also made use of the hotels free (but slow) internet connection. Enrico also has perfect English. I had been worried about staying at apartments and B&Bs over hotels before this trip. I took it as a leap of faith. However, this hotel/apartment was a really good experience. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “best location, convenient prices, great value and Enrico”
Reviews.Author: zorex
Reviews.Content: One of the best places we were staying. Not only in the middle of the city, in a old and charming roman palazzo, but the best is the host Enrico. He is welcoming you with a bottle of red italian wine, and we were lucky to find it refiled every day :), plus a lot of good information about how to reach some destinations, were to go, what worth to see to avoid touristic traps, a lot of books/tour guides of Rome on the entrance for free lecture...so enjoy. It's true that the room from the street it's noisy during the night...but this was only on our first night (and it was saturday night), after that we were tired enough to not hear anything and to sleep up to 9.30 in the morning. Trip advise: go to Rome not in the season, we were in beg of Novemeber the weather was very nice and no huge cues to objectives. Antiqua Roma is very close to Piazza Cavour so you will find yourself at walking distance (10 min.) from Vatican and Spanish stairs (where is metro). Buy Roma pass, it's very useful, and use the metro in all directions. Buses are also convenient, but crowded. Very close to Roma Antiqua, around 100 m, there is tratoria Francesca, if I'm remembering correctly, excellent food, not salty, not touristic restaurant, decent prices. I am definitely recommending Antiqua Roma to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: canada514
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this B&B in early October. We had two rooms. When we first arrived we were basically told that we were on our own and given a map. The rooms are clean, but very noisy. The rooms in the front get a lot of noise from the streets below. The rooms in the back were quiet, however you could hear a lot of noise in the hallway of the B&B. There are no phones you can use and the owner is not around in the evening, so you are really on your own. (when travelling with small children you would like to have the security of having someone to call in case of emergency, this B&B did not have a phone or someone there). We also heard the owner yelling at one of the other guests and since the place has little insulation, we heard the entire conversation. Not very professional in our opinion... The location however is great. The B&B is within walking distance to Via Cola di Rienzo where there are lots of shops and a few restaurants. There is also free wifi which comes in handy. If you just need a place to sleep and do not require any services (phone, helpful host, etc..) then this is a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location and friendly host”
Reviews.Author: PeterbgDenmark
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome yesterday after a wonderful stay in Rome. This B&B was excellent and at least as good as other much more expensive hotels. The location is great, close to allmost all the sights, without being on a noisy, crowded spot. The room is very fine, cosy and clean. The host was also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated and supreme value”
Reviews.Author: MortenDenmark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Rome together some seven or eight times, and I myself have visited the city on a couple of occasions besides. Planning a new trip to Rome is always a pleasure, but is also fraught with anxiety, even for those who have been there before: where will we stay? Will we be disappointed - or worse, will we get ripped off, will something go wrong? This time, I looked for a B&B, which would offer good value for money, would be pleasant to stay at and would really, actually be in the city centre (they all seem to be located "in the heart of the city", even when this means you have to walk four kilometres or take the metro for half an hour). Antiqua Roma is in fact centrally located, good value, and a really nice place to stay. At 100 Euro a night for a double room, you can't find better value many places in the city. The owner, Enrico, is really nice and helpful. The rooms are cosy; ours was in the back, which deprived us of a view, but made for no traffic noise, and besides, when staying at a B&B, what else is there to do except sleep? You don't hang around the room anyway, with Rome just outside. Antiqua Roma is in the Prati district, which is peaceful and where you'll find good restaurants aplenty. Via Cola di Rienzo is Rome's main shopping street (for Romans, that is, only tourists and the superrich shop in Via Condotti), and it's close by. A good ten minutes of walking, and you're at Piazza Navona or Piazza del Popolo, fifteen minutes, and you're at Saint Peter's Square. That's the beauty of staying in the Prati region, it really is centrally located, you won't need public transport for any of the sights in central Rome, and it's authentically Roman in an non-touristy way. I've stayed in various B&B's and less savoury hotels across Rome, and Antiqua Roma is the only place I can truly say I want to return to. In fact, until the time comes when I can afford to stay at Albergo del Sole and pay 400 euro a night, I'm going to toss my bags at Enrico's place. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and short walk to Vatican City and Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: RayKski
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nites at Antiqua Roma and found it to be very good and considering Rome's lodging prices, great value for your money. It was very clean, nice size room, bathroom although spotlessly clean was a little tight (we had our private bath in the shared hall). The room had a sink in it which was a nice touch when your bathroom is down the hall. I selected this place after reading all the reviews and its availability for our dates in Rome. I was a little concerned about the noise factor that many of the reviews spoke of. Our room was on the outside wall, right above the dumpsters and yes the trash people came by at least twice during our stay, but it really was not the big deal so many people made it out to be. They came, collected the trash and left - all done well before midnight. And you're on holiday in Rome, who is asleep at that time anyway? Also don't let the thought of dumpsters being outside your window scare you, this is Rome there are small dumpsters everywhere. They are not unsightly but part of the Rome landscape really. Also all of Antiqua's rooms are on the 2nd floor, that's 3rd floor to us Americans, so the dumpsters are really a ways down and not outside your windows. The one down side is location for restaurants. Yes there are places just few steps away, especially the places to get your money coffee (at least 3 good ones that we found less than a 5 minute stroll from the door, one right next to the building door). But for dinner purposes the area is a bit deserted. I did find one place only a block away that was very nice, but the other couple places nearby weren't worth it. You really had to hoof it to find dinner locations, which after a long day of hoofing it all over the city could make finding that dinner location tiring.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: Chrismcewan
Reviews.Content: Incredible place to stay for those who don't need vast luxuries in the room, but do need a place to lay their head in pleasant, safe and intimate surroundings. The room was easily big enough for the two of us, and the location was such that the far extremity of the tourist attractions (the Colesseum) was only 40 minutes away by foot, whilst the Vatican was fratcionally over 5 mins away. We received a personal greeting by Enrico, who was a top guy throughout and spoke near perfect English. In addition to complimentary wine on arrival, we received a free small bottle of champagne and a Rome calendar on New Years Eve - not expensive but a lovely touch. I'd recommend anyone to stay here if you want an ideally located hotel, where the rooms are clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “A Cosy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jody1976
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on a three week trip through Italy and it was our first experience in a European hotel, and we were quite surprised. In contrast to the reviews of other hotels, we found the rooms in this hotel to be quite large and comfortable. The rooms are well maintained and very clean. We were very impressed with the location of this hotel. It is only a ten minute walk to the Spanish Steps in one direction and the Vatican in the other direction. Very central and very convenient to all of the major tourist attractions. We walked everywhere from this hotel and found that it was the best way to get to know this wonderful city. We didn't opt for the breakfast, but there is a lovely, modern cafe just below where we ordered two cappucinos and two croissants each morning for only 5 euros. Very cheap and very good coffee. The owner and staff of this hotel are very friendly and helpful and also make for a great stay in Rome. The only negative comment that could be made about this place is the lack of insulation. The conversations on the street below sound as if they are in your room. So getting a good night sleep each night was a challenge, but once you get used to it, it isn't a big deal. If you are a light sleeper, you may find this a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, horrible street noise”
Reviews.Author: cocomero
Reviews.Content: Here's a rundown of our experience with AntiquaRoma: ROOM: Definitely above average, in terms of decor. Tastefully and conveniently furnished (unusually so), spacious and clean. Complimentary white wine and candies on the coffee table. High-ceilinged and well-ventilated. Reasonably powerful rotating fan (but no AC). TV and internal bathroom. Nice old building with character. All of these are good things. A big demerit, though, was the street noise. In ninety-plus-degree weather (Fahrenheit), and in an upper-floor dwelling like this one, it is essential that windows remain open at all times - especially at night, when there's a chance to pull in the cool night air. Unfortunately, open windows also mean noise, and the worst noise involved the garbage pick-up. At exactly midnight every night, a lumbering garbage truck came by, stopped right under our window, and repeatedly went through the following procedure: 1.) powered its hydraulic mechanical arm, 2.) used the arm to lift a gigantic metal dumpster, 3.) emptied the dumpster and its rattling contents into a metal garbage truck, 4.) plunked the dumpster back onto the pavement. Because there are several dumpsters within one or two blocks of the B&B, this nightly process seemed to take about 20 minutes, growing or decreasing in volume according to the truck's proximity, and reaching a cacophonous peak at the moment it stopped right outside our front door. For some people, who might not be trying to sleep at midnight, this would not be an issue. But we were in the habit of getting up early and doing the bulk of our sightseeing during the cool morning hours, so the nightly disturbance had a big impact on us. Note: We believe Antiqua Roma also has rooms facing onto an interior courtyard, and this could be a better option. In extremely hot weather, however, courtyard-facing rooms are often very slow to cool off in the evening. (We know this from experience.) Thanks to this Scylla/Charybdis situation, we would probably not stay at AntiquaRoma again during the summer, room quality notwithstanding. LOCATION: Antiqua Roma is in a pretty good location. The neighborhood itself is more bustling and modern, with wider streets and swifter traffic, than many other neighborhoods in central Rome. This can make you feel like you're well outside the "historic center." However in actuality, sights like the Castel Sant'Angelo, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon are only a short walk away. BREAKFAST: You can get a discount by opting out of breakfast. We did this, and took our breakfast instead at the chocolate shop/coffee bar across the street (Ciocolatti). They will make you an espresso with melted dark chocolate in it. HOST: Enrico is very professional, and speaks English very well. He is also somewhat brusque, as other reviewers have indicated. The housekeeper is very sweet, though she does not speak any English. OTHER STUFF: AntiquaRoma offers free WiFi, and also has a computer in the common area for public use. Another nice feature was the library of fairly up-to-date, big-name travel guides. Like many other Roman B&Bs, AntiquaRoma asks for payment in cash no later than the day before departure. SUMMARY: This is actually a pretty nice place. We're a bit sorry to give it a "three circle" review, but the street noise really killed us. We would consider staying here again in the winter, however.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have hoped for”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivDaniel
Reviews.Content: The Antiqua Roma is a small guesthouse in an incredible location, walking distance from just about everything (just over one of the bridges over the Tiber). It is extremely comfortable and clean, and we found the staff friendly and helpful. Our room was the only one here that had a separate bathroom (i.e. need to walk across the hall to a bathroom which is only for our room) but everything was soon clean and tasteful that it really didn't matter. We would highly recommend the Antiqua Roma for inexpensive, well-located and enjoyable accommodation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely B&B!!”
Reviews.Author: dtsapikidou
Reviews.Content: Lovely Bed & Breakfast, great value for money especially if you consider how overpriced hotels in Rome are during high season months. Clean and spacy rooms with private bathroom and clean towels/bed sheets. We didn't opt for breakfast but we didn't regret it as there are lovely cafe's just around the corner where you can enjoy your Italian cappuccino in a sunny terrasse. The location is ideal if you want to avoid the touristic hassle but still be in the city centre. Most of the attractions are on walking distance, i.e. Vatican 15 min, Piazza di Spagna 10 min. Overall, great experience, I would recommend this to a friend and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: JRichOttawa
Reviews.Content: This B&B is perfectly located to explore Rome. The room was spacious, clean and we had a private bathroom. The owner Enrico was friendly and helpful. He provided us with a map, bus routes and tourist information upon arrival. There was an internet laptop we could use and there is free WIFI if you bring your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic B&B”
Reviews.Author: Sarahwilli03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Antiqua Roma for five nights and had an excellent time. We were given great directions and when we arrived the owner Enrico was waiting to meet us. Our room was nicely decorated, very comfortable and lovely and clean. The B&B is perfectly positioned to explore all the main sites of Rome and I would thoroughly recommend it as it was extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to walk everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: WooIsMe
Reviews.Content: A comfortable, nicely decorated place to stay that was very convenient to many places of interest within walking distance. Lovely owner who was kind and helpful. Above all clean!

Reviews.Title: “Tasty trastrevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice room in a great area . Can be niosy on a Saturday night but the best thing to do is stay up late and realy enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days with my girlfriend in June 2004. The area was great, so much more relaxed than the rest of Rome. It's on a cobbled street lined with small, quirky bars and restaurants, and we ate one of the best meals of our fortnight in the place a few doors down. The room itself is not your average hotel suite. It's small, but on a split level, so the bed is up a spiral staircase beneath dark wooden beams. There's a power shower downstairs and a telly and sofa, and with breakfast being served in the friendly cafe across the road (you're given vouchers) you really feel like you're just in your own flat. The owners are friendly and unobtrusive, all in all a great little sanctuary away from the bustle of the city. I've recommended it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice but very loud”
Reviews.Author: vergerD
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4-night stay at Antiqua Roma B&B in Trastevere. While the room was nice and reasonably priced by Rome standards, this was by far the noisiest place I've ever stayed. Trastevere has night life that rivals New Orleans' Bourbon St. In addition to hundreds of people on the street right under our window, the inn is over a bar that blasted music all night, every night. This went on until 3:00 or 4:00am, with noise of morning deliveries, etc. starting up in the morning around 6:30 am. We wore earplugs every night and still weren't able to sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Antiqua Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marianna Dionigi 17, 00186 Rome, Italy
